required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Research Intervention to Support Healthy Eating and Exercise
clinical_study.official_title: Using Behavioral Economic Strategies to Address Obesity in Economically Disadvantaged Adults

collaborator.agency: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK)

brief_summary.textblock: The primary aim of this study is to test the efficacy of a behavioral economics intervention for weight loss in adults from economically disadvantaged backgrounds.

primary_outcome.description: Weight change measured on a digital scale to the nearest 0.1-kilogram

arm_group.description: Participants will receive a 12-month behavioral weight loss intervention delivered primarily via mobile phone (mHealth) that includes behavioral economics components.
Participants will receive a 12-month behavioral weight loss intervention delivered primarily via mobile phone (mHealth).

intervention.description: Participants will receive a 12-month behavioral weight loss intervention delivered primarily via mobile phone (mHealth) that includes behavioral economics components.
Participants will receive a 12-month behavioral weight loss intervention delivered primarily via mobile phone (mHealth).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age between 18-75
- BMI between 25-55kg/m2
- All sexes
- All racial/ethnic groups
- Low SES and/or report qualifying for federal, state or local benefits
- Have a smartphone and willing to use for research purposes
Exclusion Criteria:
- <18-75>years of age
- Report being unable to walk 2 blocks without stopping
- Are currently participating in weight loss treatment, have a history of bariatric surgery, or lost â‰¥5% in the past 6-months
- Are pregnant or plan to become pregnant within 1 year
- Report a heart condition, chest pain during periods of rest or activity, or loss of consciousness on the Physical Activity Readiness Questionnaire
- Report a medical condition that could jeopardize their safety in a weight control program with diet and exercise guidelines
- Have diabetes and are on insulin
- Report a medical condition that could jeopardize their safety in a weight loss program with diet and exercise guidelines
- Report conditions that, in the judgment of the PI, would render them unlikely to follow the protocol (e.g., relocation, dementia, unable to read and write in English)
- Report unable to read and write English

clinical_study.keyword: weight loss, low income, behavioral economics, contingency management, episodic future thinking, mHealth
